body.p: Which of the following best describes the method of randomized response?

input.choice: A method in which subjects answer the questions in a survey in a random order
A technique used to minimize the bias in the responses of subjects to sensitive questions
A method in which subjects answer each of the questions in a survey with a random guess

response.feedback: Incorrect. Randomized response isn’t a sampling method, because it doesn’t involve how the subjects are chosen to be interviewed.
Incorrect. In randomized response, the word randomized does not refer to the order of the survey questions.

Correct. Randomized response is a technique designed to disguise individual responses (thus putting the people more at ease about revealing embarrassing information) while retaining the overall proportional results (thus still making the study useful).
Incorrect. There is something about the subject’s answer that gets randomized in the andomized response technique, but it’s not their answers to all the survey questions.

body.p: When surveying subjects about sensitive or self-incriminating topics, what technique might be used to help ensure that individuals answer sensitive or self-incriminating questions honestly?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Simple, direct questions are a good way to make sure the respondents are answering the question that you are asking, but it does not help make them more likely to answer honestly if the topic is sensitive or even self-incriminating.

Incorrect. Putting the questions in random order may help eliminate a bias created when earlier questions inform later ones, but it does not help make respondents more likely to answer honestly if the topic is sensitive or even self-incriminating.
Incorrect. Technically complex questions often confuse respondents and will not help make them more likely to answer honestly if the topic is sensitive or self-incriminating.
Correct. Randomized responses allow respondents to be anonymous when answering a question and make it more likely that they will answer a sensitive or self-incriminating question.
